meanings.definition: To obtain something by deceit or cunning.
meanings.sent1: He weaseled his way into getting extra cookies by pretending to be hungry.
meanings.sent2: The thief weaseled the valuable necklace from the unsuspecting victim.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox weaseled the juicy grapes from the vineyard without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: She weaseled her name to the top of the list by manipulating the voting process.
meanings.sent5: The sly raccoon weaseled the shiny trinket from the picnic basket with ease.

meanings.definition: To evade or dodge a question or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: When asked about his whereabouts, he weaseled out of giving a direct answer.
meanings.sent2: She weaseled her way out of doing the dishes by pretending to be busy.
meanings.sent3: The politician weaseled around the tough questions during the interview.
meanings.sent4: He weaseled out of taking the blame for the broken vase by pointing fingers at his brother.
meanings.sent5: The student weaseled out of detention by promising to improve his behavior.
